elements.description:
We needed to split the rangepicker into two different components
because of the way we hoist the panel

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: _imperativeKeyBindings
properties.description: own properties of everything on the "prototype".

properties.name: keyBindings
properties.description:
To be used to express what combination of keys  will trigger the relative
callback. e.g. `keyBindings: { 'esc': '_onEscPressed'}`

properties.name: blockFutureDates
properties.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow future dates to be selected (future dates will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: blockPastDates
properties.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow past dates to be selected (past dates will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: __localizationCache
properties.description:
Internal singleton cache. This is the private implementation of the
behaviour; don't interact with it directly.

properties.name: language
properties.description: set a default for localizing

properties.name: resources
formats
useKeyIfMissing
properties.description:
Use the key for localization if value for  language is missing. Should
always be true for  our components

properties.name: localize
properties.description:
Translates a string to the current `language`. Any parameters to the
string should be passed in order, as follows:
`localize(stringKey, param1Name, param1Value, param2Name, param2Value)`

properties.name: bubbleEvent
properties.description: If true, will bubble up the event to the parents

properties.name: timeZone
properties.description:
Moment-timezone string for using a specific timezone. See
http://momentjs.com/timezone/docs/#/data-loading/getting-zone-names/.

If not provided, tries to guess the current local timezone.

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: The minimum / earliest allowed date, as a a Moment object or an ISO 8601 String (dates before this will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: maxDate
properties.description: The maximum / latest allowed date, as a a Moment object or an ISO 8601 String (dates after this will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.name: fromMoment
properties.description: Moment object start date & time

properties.name: toMoment
properties.description: Moment object end date & time

properties.name: presetRanges
properties.description: The preset date/time ranges to be displayed.

properties.name: _tempFromMomentObj
properties.description:
Temporary from moment object used for validation and displaying.
This object should be used by subcomponents when we want to "try"
a value and see the result of validation AND/OR give us the ability
to rollback (cancel) or apply

properties.name: _tempToMomentObj
properties.description:
Temporary to moment object used for validation and displaying.
This object should be used by subcomponents when we want to "try"
a value and see the result of validation AND/OR give us the ability
to rollback (cancel) or apply

properties.name: showButtons
properties.description: Whether to show Apply and Cancel buttons in the components

properties.name: opened
properties.description: Whether the panel is opened

properties.name: dateFormat
properties.description: Moment format used to format the date

properties.name: timeFormat
properties.description: Moment format used to format the time

properties.name: hideTime
properties.description: Whether to allow time selection as well in this date picker

properties.name: hidePresets
properties.description: Whether to show the preset date/time ranges

properties.name: hideIcon
properties.description: Controls whether the calendar/clock icon should be hidden

properties.name: allowWrap
properties.description: Whether to allow the range field to wrap at smaller screen resolutions / parent container sizes.

properties.name: showFieldTitles
properties.description:
This will remove the `to` inbetween the fields and
add titles above the fields. This allows for a
more flexable design.

properties.name: scrollAction
properties.description:
Controls if the page can be scrolled when the
panel is open.
Sets the `scrollAction` property on `iron-dropdown`

lock - blocks scrolling from happening
refit - computes the new position of the panel
cancel - causes the overlay to close

properties.name: isValid
properties.description: Whether the currently selected date is valid

properties.name: timeIsValid
properties.description: Whether the currently selected date is valid

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Boolean stating if the range field is required.
Will result in an error if left blank.

properties.name: hideValidationMessages
properties.description: Hides the validation messages if set to true

properties.name: showTimeZone
properties.description:
Timezone display format
- 'dropdown': shows the timezone as a dropdown with which the user can select a different timezone. Contains only a subset of all timezones.
- 'extendedDropdown': shows the timezone as a dropdown with which user can select a different timezone. Contains all existing timezones (588 total).
- 'text': shows the timezone as text, non-editable.
- 'abbreviatedText': shows the timezone as abbreviated text, non-editable (e.g. UTC, PST, EST).

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

methods.name: __computeLocalize
methods.description: Returns a computed `localize` method, based on the current `language`.

methods.name: _preserveTime
methods.description:
Copies the time in toPreserve to dest and returns dest.
used in `px-calendar-picker`, `px-datetime-picker`, and `px-datetime-range-panel`

methods.name: _localeChanged
methods.description: make sure the moment obj picks up the possibly new moment locale

methods.name: _timeZoneChanged
methods.description: makes sure the moment objects reflect the timezone

methods.name: _validateRangeOrder
methods.description: Validation for the range. Makes sure the ranges are in chronological order

return.desc: true if chronological order, false otherwise

methods.name: _applyTempRangeMoment
methods.description: Applies value of temp moment to public momentObj

methods.name: _rollbackTempFromMoment
methods.description: Rollback value of temp fromMoment to use public momentObj

methods.name: _rollbackTempToMoment
methods.description: Rollback value of temp toMoment to use public momentObj

methods.name: _localeChangedTemp
methods.description: make sure the moment obj pick up the possibly new moment locale

methods.name: _timeZoneChangedTemp
methods.description: makes sure the moment objects reflect the timezone

methods.name: _toggleBoxOpen
methods.description:
Opens the calendar if closed, closes it if opened
called in `px-rangepicker.html`

methods.name: _handleValidation
methods.description:
Sets the `allowApply` prop on `px-datetime-range-panel`
called in `px-rangepicker.html`

methods.name: _handleIsValid
methods.description:
helper function to added the invalid class on the range panel
if the rangepicker is invalid

methods.name: _updatedStyleOnValid
methods.description:
needed for polymer 1 only.
The implementation of the css-custom-properties is different form polymer 1 to polymer 2.
In polymer 1 css-custom-properties are not always dynamic. In this specific case when
the `invalid` class is applied to `px-datetime-range-panel`, I want the css variables in
`px-calendar-picker` to update.
I am forcing an `updateStyles` so that the styles cross the tree will be reapplied.
This allows for the new css-variables to be applied to the sub-component. It is
generally a last resort to for `updateStyles`.

elements.description:
The datetime components rely on [Moment.js](https://momentjs.com/) and [Moment Timezone](https://momentjs.com/timezone/).

#### Usage

    <px-rangepicker
      from-moment="{{...}}"
      to-moment="{{...}}">
    </px-rangepicker>

#### Styling
The following custom property is available for styling. Please also refer to px-forms-design, px-datetime-range-field, and px-datetime-range-panel for additional style variables used by this component.

Custom property | Description
:----------------|:-------------
`px-datetime` components | the css variables are defined in the other `px-datetime` components
`--px-datetime-field-margin-bottom` | Sets the margin under the fields. If allowWrap is true this should be set to 20px.
`--px-datetime-range-field-margin-between-fields` | When `showFieldTitles` is true this is the amount of space between the fields
`--px-datetime-range-field-column-min-width` | When `fullWidth` is true this sets the min-width that each field is allowed to be before the grid wraps.
`--px-datetime-range-field-justify-fields` | Sets the flex `justify-content` value for the fields

properties.description:

`null` to disable the listeners.

properties.description: Key bindings for iron-a11y-keys-behavior

properties.description: Set this attribute when you do not want to allow future dates to be selected (future dates will be disabled and unclickable).

properties.description: Moment object end date & time

properties.name: presetRanges
_tempFromMomentObj

Temporary from moment object used for validation and displaying.

properties.name: showButtons
properties.description: Whether to show Apply and Cancel buttons in the components

properties.name: containerType
properties.description: An optional type set on the px-overlay-container and px-overlay-content to associate specific overlay-contents with their container

properties.name: opened
properties.description: Whether the panel is opened

properties.name: dateFormat
properties.description: Moment format used to format the date

properties.name: timeFormat
properties.description: Moment format used to format the time

properties.name: hideTime
properties.description: Whether to allow time selection as well in this date picker

properties.name: hidePresets
properties.description: Whether to show the preset date/time ranges

properties.name: hideIcon
properties.description: Controls whether the calendar/clock icon should be hidden

properties.name: allowWrap
properties.description: Whether to allow the range field to wrap at smaller screen resolutions / parent container sizes.

properties.name: showFieldTitles
properties.description:
This will remove the `to` inbetween the fields and
add titles above the fields. This allows for a
more flexable design.

properties.name: fullWidth
properties.description:
For layout purposes.
This will display grid the fields. `showFieldTitles` must be true for styles to take effect.

`--px-datetime-range-field-column-min-width` (default: 250px) - controls
the min-width that each field is allowed to be before the grid wraps.

`--px-datetime-range-field-margin-between-fields` (default: 10px) - controls
the horizontal spacing between the fields.

This means each field will take up half of the container that `px-datetime-range-field`
is in, minus the space between the fields. When the container scales smaller than 510px or
`(--px-datetime-range-field-column-min-width * 2 + --px-datetime-range-field-margin-between-fields)`.

The fields will wrap under each other regardless of the `allow-wrap` prop in every browser except for IE.
Setting this property will override anything set in the `--px-datetime-range-field-justify-fields`

properties.name: scrollAction
properties.description:
Controls if the page can be scrolled when the
panel is open.
Sets the `scrollAction` property on `iron-dropdown`

lock - blocks scrolling from happening
refit - computes the new position of the panel
cancel - causes the overlay to close

properties.name: isValid
properties.description: Whether the currently selected date is valid

properties.name: required
properties.description:
Boolean stating if the range field is required.
Will result in an error if left blank.

properties.name: hideValidationMessages
properties.description: Hides the validation messages if set to true

properties.name: showTimeZone
properties.description:
Timezone display format
- 'dropdown': shows the timezone as a dropdown with which the user can select a different timezone. Contains only a subset of all timezones.
- 'extendedDropdown': shows the timezone as a dropdown with which user can select a different timezone. Contains all existing timezones (588 total).
- 'text': shows the timezone as text, non-editable.
- 'abbreviatedText': shows the timezone as abbreviated text, non-editable (e.g. UTC, PST, EST).

properties.name: hoist
properties.description: Specifies if the dropdown content should get hoisted to a container in order to escape its current stacking context

methods.description: Validation for the range. Makes sure the ranges are in chronological order

return.desc: true if chronological order, false otherwise

methods.name: _applyTempRangeMoment
methods.description: Applies value of temp moment to public momentObj

methods.name: _rollbackTempFromMoment
methods.description: Rollback value of temp fromMoment to use public momentObj

methods.name: _rollbackTempToMoment
methods.description: Rollback value of temp toMoment to use public momentObj

methods.name: _localeChangedTemp
methods.description: make sure the moment obj pick up the possibly new moment locale

methods.name: _timeZoneChangedTemp
methods.description: makes sure the moment objects reflect the timezone

methods.name: _toggleBoxOpen
methods.description: Opens the calendar if closed, closes it if opened

methods.name: _processClose
methods.description:
If the buttons are not showing and both the range-field & range-panel
are valid then apply the values shown in the temp values
If one of those conditions are false revert back the temp
values to the saved momentobjs

methods.name: _rangeFieldMomentChanged
methods.description:
If the panel is not open then apply the changes
coming from the range-fields

methods.name: _handleValidation
methods.description: update the `isValid` property based on validity of range-field

methods.name: _validateCalendarMoment
methods.description:
If the calendar is open and the rangeField is valid
when enter/apply is pressed apply the calendar value.
We only want the calendar to close if the selection is applied

methods.name: _handleTap
methods.description: If the calendar is open and the dropdown is selected, close the calendar
